answers.answer: I can't imagine getting my husband to take every Thursday off to go with me, hes gone to 2 appointments cuz they were ultrasounds which I was lucky to get that..I would prefer him going to all my appointments but I realize he has to work too and he has him own stresses from that, just try to work with him..its not the end of the world if he misses the appointments

My hubby has been a jerk as well but in different ways too many to list! Focus on you and the baby ignore him that's what I do sometimes they like to press our buttons and get a reaction out of us don't give him the satisfaction show him you can do it without him and that's when he will get back on board.

My husband went to every appt with my first kid but with my second and third he came to only the 20 week ultrasound.  I think you should tell him his behavior is not acceptable and hurts your feelings..smoking around the baby is bad. You could also go the other route and cut him some slack as he might be feeling anxious about becoming a daddy.
Tell him to grow up and stop acting like a child.

My husbad is very supportive but he has only gone with me to the ultrasounds cause I really dont want him there at every appointment. And now that I have to go more often because of gestational diabetes I dont expect him to go to all of them. I know that u might feel frustrated because hes doing what he wants to do but maybe he wants time for himself before the baby comes. The important part is he helps when the baby is born. Dont stress about it now.

You are not alone ! My bf stopped going to appts after my last ultra sound. He doesn't help with the baby at all really. He hasn't bought anything he says his contribution is paying the bills and providing the roof over our heads. Smh he has become secretive about what he buys now because I told him his priorities are all messed up he'll buy mary Jane and beer but can't buy a box of pampers. Our little girl is going to need more than a roof over her head to survive. Smh I feel like I could of did this by myself because I'm doing it now and I'd say I'm doing a pretty great job. 7days til due date and he still can't get it together.
Is go on strike, no more meals no more cleaning! My excuse I'm tired, have a nice day!!!
If I am going to act and feel like a single mom.. I am going to be a single mom.. just saying

It's the point is that he said and scheduled all the days off for the appointments. I have GD and preeclampsia. I havent made him go to every appointment. But I feel when someone, specifically my husband, says he's going to be there with me for every appointment and then backs out because of one night of video games and beer that is extremely disrespectful and unsupportive. He gets his time alone as he only works part time and I pull 90+ hours a week for work.

My fiance has only gone to like 3 appointments with me. He didnt even go to the ultrasound to find out what we were having. My grandmother goes with me now that i have to go have stress tests and blood work done every week. Men just dont understand that we need their support.

My husband came to quite a few appts or if we knew they were important, but once it was just heartbeat and basic stuff i told him it was fine if he didn't come. He didnt need to miss a whole day of work for a 5 min appt.....Now with that said, if he took work off for it or just happened to be off work that day he would definitely be there. I would not be ok with what he is doing. He needs to go to your next appt so maybe your dr can enlighten him on pre-e so he's not just hearing it from you. And i would never just ignore it and let him get away with it, because he will just keep doing it. Not all men act like that.  I know someone just like that, though. Has 3 kids and doesn't help the mom whatsoever. It's quite sad and it's hard to be around because the mom is great and works so hard and has a job. Luckily that bothers my hubby a lot and i know my hub helps out as much as possible and he works right now and i'm not because we moved and he suggested i wait til after baby.
Wow yeah. Not acceptable. If he already has the days off...he should be there. Especially with you working full time and him part time.

question: I'm 32 weeks and I have preeclampsia. It was suspected at 28 weeks and confirmed at 30. I have weekly appointments with weekly ultrasounds and bpps. Mt husband this morning decided that because these are 'routine' visits he doesn't have to come anymore unless it's a 'big' appointment.What grinds me is that he has taken every thursday off until my october 16th due date so he can attend the weekly appointments. Then after a late night of video games and beer drinking (till 3 am) he decided he doesn't have to go. I was so mad at him this morning I just left the apartment for work and forgot all my food for the day (12 hour work shift).He's been having like this 'last hurrah' over the last three weeks. He returned to smoking (afyer being clean since March) and drinking way more than normal. He won't help put baby stuff together.  Won't help with the dog or making amy of our meals. I feel like I'm doing everything by myself.
title: husband being an idiot rant
